content.en: Red blood cell aggregation: Algorithms are being used in various scientific studies to investigate the characteristics and effects of red blood cell aggregation. These algorithms enable researchers to differentiate between different diseases based on erythrocyte aggregation characteristics, quantitatively measure the ability of red blood cells to aggregate, analyze ultrasound scattering data to study the dynamics of red cell aggregates, and predict how red blood cell clustering affects ultrasound blood backscatter. Additionally, algorithms are used to assess the level of red blood cell aggregation, simulate the effects of aggregation on ultrasound backscattering, analyze light-scattering and light-transmission measurements, measure the deformability of red blood cells, and detect and monitor red blood cell aggregation using ultrasound signals and image processing techniques.
content.da: Aggregering af røde blodlegemer: Algoritmer bruges i forskellige videnskabelige studier til at undersøge karakteristika og effekter af aggregering af røde blodlegemer. Disse algoritmer gør det muligt for forskere at skelne mellem forskellige sygdomme baseret på erytrocyt-aggregeringsegenskaber, kvantitativt måle de røde blodlegemers evne til at aggregere, analysere ultralydsscatteringsdata for at studere dynamikken i røde blodlegemers aggregationer samt forudsige, hvordan sammenklumpning af røde blodlegemer påvirker ultralydsblood-backscatter. Desuden bruges algoritmer til at vurdere niveauet af røde blodlegemers aggregering, simulere effekterne af aggregering på ultralydsbacksattering, analysere lys-sprednings- og lystransmissionsmålinger, måle de røde blodlegemers deformerbarhed og opdage og overvåge aggregering af røde blodlegemer ved hjælp af ultralydssignaler og billedbehandlingsteknikker.
